articles.title: Wall Street Roundup: Jobs Data, Gold Highs, AI + Tariff Impact
articles.summary: Jobs data and politicized rate cuts, gold highs, silver surging; retail earnings a mix, AI impacts bottom lines.
articles.text:
Sergo2/iStock via Getty Images

Sergo2/iStock via Getty Images

Listen below or on the go on Apple Podcasts and Spotify

Jobs data and politicized rate cuts (0:25) Gold highs, silver surging (2:10) Retail earnings a mix (3:25) Google and how AI is hitting bottom lines (6:45)

Take today's Investment News Quiz!

Transcript

Rena Sherbill: Brian Stewart, Seeking Alpha's Director of news, welcome back to Wall Street Roundup.

Brian Stewart: Great to be here.

RS: Set the stage for us. What's top of mind for you as we start September, a shortened trading week? Talk to us.

BS: If we're talking themes, I think, the jobs data is coming out. We're recording this Thursday, so listeners will probably have a little bit more information than we do right now about what the jobs data is gonna say.

That puts into the frame of the Federal Reserve. Currently, there's a 97% chance, according to the FedWatch tool, that the Fed's going to cut rates in September.

That's been inching higher recently. So it was kind of in the mid eighties as of last week, but has now kind of reached the the level of in that inevitability.

Obviously, the idea of a rate cut has become highly politicized. The Fed is basically at war with the president. So maybe having this cut happen might relieve some of that tension, that might give markets a little relief, not to mention the relief that's gonna come with the idea that their rates are gonna be lower.

One issue though is the inflation statistics remain kind of unmovable. You haven't seen those metrics show much relief. You're seeing inflation in the PCE last week showing just under 3%, 2.9 annual growth.

Next week, we got CPI coming out, probably gonna show something very similar. So you see the Fed facing the sticky inflation with the tariff impact still TBD.

Meanwhile, the jobs data has started to underwhelm to the point where rate cuts are becoming inevitable. So that tension's going to be critical for the next couple weeks.

RS: And anything you would mention as we talk about governments and monetary policy, it makes me think of the record prices that gold ( XAUUSD:CUR ) has been hitting, silver ( XAGUSD:CUR ) has been surging.

How much are you looking at the precious metal sector, the bond sector perhaps?

BS: It's interesting to to think about the two high profile parts of the market right now remain AI and gold, which seem very far removed in terms of the usual constituencies for those investments.

So it's kind of interesting that that's where we're at, where you have an inflation hedge that's become very popular as a place to store money for many investors.

Meanwhile, people are still making bets in the AI space, hoping that'll be the engine for the market to go higher.

And meanwhile, you have kind of this middle ground where most of equities are falling, where it's more a stock picker kind of situation.

So I do think that's something to keep an eye on, is the further activity in the gold market because I think that'll give a great sign of what people feel about inflation.

RS: And earnings wise this week, what were you focused on?

BS: So there were a lot of retailers that came out and it was kind of a interesting mix there. You had Macy's ( M ) which which popped after its earnings. Investors seeing signs of a turnaround there.

Its stock rose 21% after its earnings, is up 71% from its April lows. April was when the worst of the tariff fears hit the retail sector, which was one of the hardest hit areas, with that scare. It's still off a fifty two week high though.

It reached its fifty two week high late last year, so it needs another 8% to get up there. The company said that it faced tariff headwinds, but saw sales improvement for its luxury brands like Bloomingdale's.

So you see there may be a worry that the higher prices, both from underlying inflation and the tariffs are going to cut into consumer spending, especially on the low end where people have less resources.

Meanwhile, you might find some winners in the luxury space because those brands are more capable of eating some of the tariffs and maybe holding prices steady and the customers have more money, so maybe they're not as impacted by those price changes.

That's underlined by what we saw from Dollar Tree ( DLTR ). Dollar Tree was down 9% following its earnings. It initially ticked higher after its earnings were released but turned into decline as people metabolize the guidance.

That had a very significant tariff impact and you can see where that would work out. If you're the kind of store that's operating on the low end of the price spectrum, you're getting a lot of your goods from overseas where you're taking advantage of cheap labor.

Now those prices are are being hit by tariffs. You're seeing a large percentage increase in those prices as compared to the percentage increase you might see in a $400 handbag or something like that.

You're starting to really cut into your customer's ability to buy more stuff. So you kinda see that bifurcation happening.

Another interesting retail story was American Eagle ( AEO ) up 26% after its earnings. This is an example of another company that's been politicized lately. They had their Sydney Sweeney campaign, which stirred some controversy, and now that was a big success, apparently.

Had a significant impact. The CEO characterized it as a record breaking customer acquisition from that marketing campaign.

So this kind of follows in the footsteps of Tesla ( TSLA ) and Cracker Barrel (CRBL). Those were different circumstances where we saw utilization of those stocks drag them down, and now you see a stock in the political spotlight that has sort of taken advantage of that notoriety to increase its sales.

So I think this might be a trend to keep an eye on as companies that rotate in and out of the political spotlight might be something investors should keep an eye on for more dramatic moves.

RS: And marketing teams everywhere trying to bottle the sauce that American Eagle just unleashed. I bet a lot of high fives being handed all around.

BS: I hope Sydney Sweeney got stock options for for her part of that deal.

RS: Yeah. I hope Sydney Sweeney got stock options also. She seems a savvy businesswoman, so maybe she did.

Google ( GOOG ) ( GOOGL ), that hit the wires this week. Chrome, etcetera, what what are you seeing out of Google? And does that portend anything for the tech space?

BS: Yeah. I think so. Google rose about 9% after news came down that they would not have to sell their Chrome browser as part of an antitrust case.

There were a few restrictions put on the company, but fundamentally, it was a slap on the wrists.

I think that, again, looking at the political side of things, it suggests that we're in a low regulation mood in terms of the overall regulatory environment, which gives big tech kind of a a green light to move ahead.

There's always simmering tension about whether or not companies like Google or Apple ( AAPL ) or Microsoft ( MSFT ) should be broken up, or at least restrained.

So I think this is just a the sign that the current environment, they don't really have anything to worry about on that front.

RS: Anything else before we leave our audience for another week?

BS: Just in terms of earnings, there's an interesting debate going on about AI and the way AI is impacting the bottom line.

So you had Salesforce ( CRM ) report its earnings. It was down 7%. This contributed to a longer term downtrend. The stock is now down 28% year to date.

It beat expectations, but its guidance was not as strong as people had hoped. It had some progress on its AI related products, but it was not falling to the bottom line as quickly as investors had hoped.

So the question coming out of that earnings report is really, is this a single company execution problem or is this a sign that the AI impact that we're all hoping for is not going to be as dramatic as expected?

And you can compare that to Alibaba ( BABA ), which was up sharply after its earnings. It had relatively modest overall revenue growth, I think around 2%, but had 26% growth in its cloud business pushed by its AI rollout.

So that's a company that's very quickly turning its AI adoption into real money, whereas Salesforce seems to be having a little trouble kind of connecting the two. So I think that's going to be a debate that comes up as we get information from these companies.

And so that shines a spotlight on Adobe ( ADBE ), which is reporting next week. I think that'll be the next company that has that same sort of internal tension going on.

I think it'll be something to look for in that earnings report and the conference call afterwards is how dramatically its AI investments are turning into revenue.

RS: We have Broadcom ( AVGO ) reporting after the close today. Anything about that that you would add into this conversation?

BS: Yeah. It's a good example. That's another one. You know, listeners are gonna have more information than we have right now about that, but that's another good data point in terms of the build out of the AI infrastructure.

I think it's interesting to put that in comparison to companies like Salesforce and Adobe because they're on the other end of it. Those are the companies that are using products from NVIDIA ( NVDA ) or Broadcom to build out their AI capabilities.

And so the question becomes, are the gold miners eventually gonna get the gold after buying the shovels and the picks from the shovel and pick salesman.

Like I said, that'll be something to keep an eye on as we move forward.

RS: And if I may set myself up for the assist, for those interested - I didn't do it deliberately. But for those interested in, Broadcom results and the tech space and some marinating post-results, we're gonna have Sara Awad from Tech Contrarians, Tech Stock Pros, back on Investing Experts midweek next week.

So look for that episode for all you tech observers and investors. Brian, appreciate you as always. Talk to you next week.

BS: Talk to you next week.

Editor's Note: This article discusses one or more securities that do not trade on a major U.S. exchange. Please be aware of the risks associated with these stocks.

This article was written by
articles.headline_text: Wall Street Roundup: Jobs Data, Gold Highs, AI + Tariff Impact

articles.text:
Imperial Petroleum Inc. ( NASDAQ: IMPP ) Q2 2025 Earnings Call September 5, 2025 10:00 AM EDT

Company Participants

Harry Vafias - CEO, President & Chairman Ifigeneia Sakellari - Interim CFO & Secretary

Presentation

Operator

Good day, and thank you for standing by. Welcome to the Q2 and 6 months 2025 Financial Operating Results of Imperial Petroleum Results Conference Call and Webcast. [Operator Instructions] Please note that today's conference is being recorded. I would now like to turn the conference over to your first speaker, Mr. Harry Vafias, CEO of Imperial Petroleum. Please go ahead.

Harry Vafias CEO, President & Chairman

Good morning, everyone, and thank you for joining us on our second quarter and 6 months 2025 conference call. I'm Harry Vafias, the CEO of Imperial Petroleum, and joining me on today is Ifigeneia Sakellari, who will be discussing our financial performance. Before we commence our discussion, please read the safe harbor disclaimer on Slide 2. In essence, it's made clear that this presentation may contain some forward-looking statements as defined by the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act.

We raise the attention of our investors to the fact that such forward-looking statements are based upon the current beliefs and expectations of Imperial Petroleum and are subject to risks and uncertainties, which could cause future results to differ materially from these forward-looking statements. In addition, we'd like to clarify, we will quote monetary amounts unless explicitly stated otherwise, in U.S. dollars.

On Slide 3, we're summarizing our key operational and financial highlights for Q2 '25. What governed Q2 '25 was our impressive fleet expansion as within a single quarter, we took delivery of 7 drybulk ships, expanding our fleet by about 56% and reaching 19 non-Chinese built vessels. Imperial Petroleum is now a company of a material size that operates a combined fleet of tanker and drybulk ships.

articles.title: iSpecimen receives crypto treasury proposals amid $200M digital plan By Investing.com
articles.summary: iSpecimen receives crypto treasury proposals amid $200M digital plan
articles.text:
iSpecimen Inc. (ISPC) announced it has been approached by several cryptocurrency companies presenting investment opportunities as the biospecimen sourcing company pursues plans to build a $200 million digital asset treasury.

The Woburn, Massachusetts-based company said the approaches include opportunities in tokenized real-world assets and highly ranked cryptocurrencies. iSpecimen continues parallel discussions to develop a Solana blockchain-based treasury program, according to a company statement.

"We are refining our approach to build a digital asset treasury. While the acquisition of Locked Solana appeals, we recognize there are many opportunities that we continue to explore," said Robert Lim, chief executive officer.

The company plans to establish a SOL-based treasury program using the native token of the Solana network to diversify its balance sheet and support growth initiatives. iSpecimen intends to source treasury management expertise for policy design, counterparty diligence, execution, custody coordination, risk management and reporting.

The treasury program contemplates purchasing SOL through over-the-counter transactions with cryptocurrency institutions, including Locked SOL that carries contractual transfer or vesting restrictions. Locked SOL typically trades at a discount to spot prices due to illiquidity and lock-up risk.

iSpecimen plans to fund the treasury program primarily from capital raised periodically. The company said it will employ a buy-and-hold strategy and purchase locked SOL at discounts. Plans include staking the Solana holdings to generate yields while maintaining a small percentage for spot trading.

iSpecimen operates an online marketplace connecting scientists with healthcare providers for human biospecimens used in medical research.
articles.headline_text: iSpecimen receives crypto treasury proposals amid $200M digital plan

articles.title: CoinW Celebrates 8 Years of Commitment with 15M Users and Trillions in Trading Volume By Chainwire
articles.summary: CoinW Celebrates 8 Years of Commitment with 15M Users and Trillions in Trading Volume
articles.text:
Hong Kong, Hong Kong, SAR, China, September 4th, 2025, Chainwire

CoinW celebrates its 8th anniversary, marking an eight-year ascent from a focused upstart to a global crypto platform. Today, it serves more than 15 million registered users and facilitates over $5 billion in 24-hour trading volume. This milestone follows a full-stack platform upgrade that unifies centralized and on-chain rails. It reflects CoinW’s steady, security-first approach to growth.

At its core, CoinW always strives to be a trusted gateway to the future of finance. In a recent open letter, founder Gary reaffirmed the vision — “Here for Crypto, Here for the Future.” Guided by this long-term strategy, the company has expanded from simple spot services into a comprehensive trading ecosystem covering derivatives, on-chain products, and professional tools, all designed to empower users with freedom and trust.

Within this ecosystem, CoinW has built one of the world’s leading derivatives exchanges — ranked top four globally by CoinGecko — while continuously enhancing products and trading experiences. This year it launched an industry - first Futures Protection Program, a monthly safeguard helping users navigate volatility with greater confidence, transparency, and control.

Building the “Future of Trading”

Enter its new, full-stack integrated architecture which confidently promises to usher in the “future of trading”. The company has made key optimizations to evolve well-past its initial iteration of diversified trading services. These upgrades provide deeper capability integrations, AI strategy execution and multi-chain interoperability. It unifies previously scattered functions and establishes a solid foundation for implementing key features in the next phase.

Beyond Trading

CoinW couples product execution with cultural reach to build trust at the community level. This year, the exchange became a regional partner of LALIGA with year-round activations across Asia. It also renewed its official Web3 sponsorship of the EAFF E-1 Football Championship, extending education and engagement on East Asia’s top football stage.

The company was recognized as “Most Trustworthy Cryptocurrency Exchange in Asia” at the 7th Hit AI & Blockchain Summit. The award reflects how steadiness and security resonate with mainstream audiences.

“Trot On To  null ” — 8th Anniversary Theme

CoinW celebrates its eighth year with the theme “Trot On To  null ,” symbolizing its commitment to moving forward with users while exploring crypto’s limitless possibilities.

To mark the occasion, CoinW will connect with its global community through online campaigns and offline meetups, highlighted by a Global 8-City Marathon. More than a celebration, these initiatives embody the “Trot On To  null ” spirit — advancing with users into the next chapter of crypto.

Looking Ahead

True to the “Trot on to  null ” spirit, CoinW will keep pushing forward with communities, enhancing products to create more opportunities for everyone. As CoinW celebrates its 8th anniversary, the platform priorities include deepening security, leading in compliance, and scaling a user-centric ecosystem that lets anyone step into crypto — and into the future — with confidence.

About CoinW

Founded in 2017, CoinW has grown into one of the world’s leading cryptocurrency asset trading platforms, serving a vast and diverse global user base. The platform offers intelligent trading services, with a daily trading volume exceeding $5 billion and a consistent top 4 ranking in CoinMarketCap’s futures markets. With over 15 million registered users, CoinW is deeply committed to advancing wealth creation and blockchain innovation, continually enhancing its product ecosystem with innovations. Since 2022, CoinW has significantly expanded its global brand presence through international sports sponsorships, including a high-profile partnership with football legend Andrea Pirlo. In addition to its commercial growth, CoinW is actively engaged in corporate social responsibility — from donating supplies to orphanages in Africa to supporting animal welfare in Taiwan. Looking ahead, CoinW aims to promote financial inclusion on a global scale, continue leading the cryptocurrency sector, and accelerate the adoption of blockchain technology and digital assets worldwide. To learn more about CoinW, users can visit the website, and follow CoinW’s X Account, and Telegram Group.

Nirvana

nirvana_li@legend.tech

This article was originally published on Chainwire
articles.headline_text: CoinW Celebrates 8 Years of Commitment with 15M Users and Trillions in Trading Volume

articles.title: NOWPayments to Participate in SiGMA Europe Rome 2025 By Chainwire
articles.summary: NOWPayments to Participate in SiGMA Europe Rome 2025
articles.text:
AMSTERDAM, NETHERLANDS, September 3rd, 2025, Chainwire

SiGMA has officially shortlisted NOWPayments in the “Best Crypto Processing” category at the SiGMA Euro-Med Awards 2025 . This acknowledgment places NOWPayments among the notable solutions in the crypto payments industry.

In addition, Forbes ranked NOWPayments #1 in its “5 Best Cryptocurrency Gateways of 2025” list — further validating the company’s growing impact on the digital payments landscape.

Participation in SiGMA Europe Rome 2025

NOWPayments has also confirmed its participation in SiGMA Europe Rome 2025 , scheduled for November. The conference is one of the largest gatherings for blockchain, fintech, and iGaming, offering a global stage for companies shaping the future of digital finance.

Solutions for iGaming Businesses

NOWPayments provides tailored crypto payment solutions for the iGaming sector. With support for 300+ cryptocurrencies , instant settlements, automated payouts, and compliance features, the gateway offers operators:

(Source: SiGMA Shortlist, Forbes)

About NOWPayments

NOWPayments , founded in 2019 , is a cryptocurrency payment gateway offering both custodial and non-custodial solutions. Its mission is to make digital assets accessible for businesses and individuals worldwide by delivering secure, seamless, and flexible payment tools. Supporting more than 300 cryptocurrencies and prioritizing compliance, NOWPayments empowers industries — from e-commerce to iGaming — to adopt crypto with confidence.

Alex Y

NOWPayments

alexandr.y@nowpayments.io

This article was originally published on Chainwire
articles.headline_text: NOWPayments to Participate in SiGMA Europe Rome 2025
